variations.name: Button (Primary)
variations.description: The primary button is used for the principle call to action on a page. It should be used sparingly, to draw attention to the most important actions on a page.

variations.name: Button (Secondary)
variations.description: The secondary button is used for secondary actions on each page. It should be used for actions that are less important than the primary action on a page.

variations.name: Button (Danger)
variations.description: The danger button is used for actions that are destructive. It should be used for actions that are irreversible, such as deleting a user or a page.

variations.name: Button (Success)
variations.description: The success button is used for actions that are successful. It should be used for actions that are reversible, such as saving a user or a page.

variations.name: Button (Warning)
variations.description: The warning button is used for actions that are warning. It should be used for actions that are reversible, such as saving a user or a page.
